meanings.definition: To injure a joint by a sudden twist or wrench
meanings.sent1: I accidentally sprain my ankle while playing soccer.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to sprain your wrist when lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent3: I sprain my knee every time I try to dance like a robot.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to sprain his heart, leaving him in emotional pain.
meanings.sent5: The sudden twist in the plot sprained my brain trying to keep up.

meanings.definition: An injury to a joint caused by a sudden twist or wrench
meanings.sent1: After the fall, he was diagnosed with a sprain in his ankle.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped her sprained wrist with a bandage to support it.
meanings.sent3: The sprain in his elbow made it difficult for him to lift anything heavy.
meanings.sent4: The sprain in the plan caused delays in the project timeline.
meanings.sent5: The sprain in the bridge weakened its structure, causing concern among engineers.
